entry.title: How to unassign an Authorization Package from an S-user ID in SAP for Me
entry.content:
As an administrator managing user access in SAP for Me is a critical part of maintaining system security and operational efficiency. Whether you're onboarding new users as an admin, or adjusting access for existing ones, knowing how to properly assign and revoke authorization packages is essential. 

 

Why This Matters?

Authorization packages define what an S-user ID can access within the SAP for Me ecosystem—from support cases to license data, viewing systems, software download, etc. Keeping these permissions up to date ensures compliance, prevents unauthorized access, and streamlines user roles across your organization.

 

Steps:  

  1. Log in to SAP for Me using your S-user ID and password.  
  2.  In the SAP for Me homepage, click on “Users & Contacts” tab under Dashboard at the left side of your screen.  
  3. Then, click on “Manage Users & Authorization” card. Or simply go to User Management.  
  4. Under the list of users, find the S-user ID to unassign the authorization package from. Or simply use the search field to search for the specific S-user ID and click on the magnifying glass to search.  
  5. Click on the user/S-user ID (not the checkbox).
  6. Click on the EXISTING AUTHORIZATION PACKAGES tab.  
  7. Click the Edit (Pencil) icon on the top right of that section. 
  8. Click on the checkbox in front of the Authorization Package(s) to be removed. 
  9. Click OK. 
  10. Click Save on the top right of the EXISTING AUTHORIZATION PACKAGES section. 

     

For more details, please refer to Knowledge Base Article: 2878696 - How to unassign an Authorization Package from an S-user ID - SAP for Me. 

 

Got More Questions?  

The Customer Interaction Center is always ready to support you with any of the listed processes and is happy to assist with questions regarding case-related matters, SAP for Me navigation, S-user ID, or SAP Universal ID. 

 

Alternatively, please feel free to ask us in the Q&A   All Questions in Customer Experience | SAP Community and All Questions in Support Services | SAP Community 

 

Don't Miss Out on Free Webcasts  

We would like to invite you to our free webcasts, which we believe can help you get the best from your support in SAP. You can find all upcoming webcasts on https://events.sap.com/supportwebcasts/en/home. These sessions are open to all the users and will revolve around hot topics in support today such as SAP for Me, Case Management, Universal ID, etc. Additionally, you can explore a range of CIC how-to videos at learning.sap.com. Please feel free to share this information with your colleagues. We are looking forward to your attendance.  

 

Lastly, you may want to access all Customer Interaction Center Blogs here:  https://community.sap.com/t5/tag/CustomerInteractionCenter/tg-p/board-id/crm-blog-sap. 

 

Thanks for reading!  We hope you found this guide helpful.

After an incredible round of live demos, real-time feedback from our expert judges, and audience voting, one partner emerged on top:

This year’s event once again proved that the power of collaboration between SAP and our partners is driving meaningful change across HR, from AI and analytics to employee experience and skills development.

entry.title: ATP in Sales Orders no longer considers QI stock with EWM
entry.content:
Hi,

We've recently moved from stock room management to EWM (embedded). 

We've noticed since moving that stock in quality inspection in the EWM warehouse is not considered in the availability when running ATP in sales orders, so is pushing out availability dates to the full lead time.

The Scope of check has not changed and I can see that it still thinks it is looking at stock in Quality Inspection, but when looking at the Availability Overview it is clear that only unrestricted stock is being considered.

When viewing MD04, the QI stock is included in the total available quantity at the top of the screen, but it does not show the QM lots as part of the MRP elements as it did previously.

Has anyone else experienced this issue when moving to EWM?

entry.title: How to prevent techinical users to not perform a dialog login in PI/PO
entry.content:
Hi SAP,

How can we prevent SAP PO technical users from doing a dialog login. Could you please share the approach and steps to be followed.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to prevent techinical users to not perform a dial...
entry.content:
The most effective approach is to configure technical users as Service users rather than Dialog users. Service users are designed for technical integrations and system-to-system communication 

If the requirement is that no end users should be able to login to the SAP Application Server JAVA, check SAP KBA 2151943 .

In order to prevent dialog logons you can lock multiple users following below steps:

1.Go to http://<host>:<port>/useradmin
2.Search for the user while leaving the field empty
3.Chose the button 'Go'
4.This will output all the users
5.Select all the users and deselect the one don't want
6.Choose button 'Lock'
7.It will prompt to write a reason for locking the users. The system sends this text to the user, if it gets enabled e-mail notification. The text is also stored in the user's account history.
8.Enter a text and choose the Lock button.

2479106 - How to Lock all users explicitly in SAP NetWeaver AS Java

entry.title: Re: post method fails with "Unexpected text for XML-ABAP...
entry.content: It's Atom XML. The problem is that you don't show the part corresponding to your data. In Atom XML, the entity data is shown after "<content type="application/xml">". I don't know your OData entities and I'm not familiar with Atom XML. Atom XML was never used in all my projects. Could you request the result in JSON? (append ?$format=json to your URI) Also, show the part of your entity which corresponds to the XML. In short, describe your entity and show the entity data in the result.

entry.title: How to download supplier and customer invoice in Mass (PDF copies)?
entry.content:
There is a requirement to know how to download supplier and customer invoices in mass as PDF copies.

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to download supplier and customer invoice in Mass...
entry.content:
In S/4HANA Public Cloud, multiple PDFs can be downloaded from Billing Documents using API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV/GetPDF. The action itself can be called for only one billing document, however, multiple service requests can be triggered to download PDFs massively by coding a loop logic in the external system.

Refer to the following documentation for full information:

  • 3208892 - How to mass download PDF invoices in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - SAP for Me
  • API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV/GetPDF - Get PDF of Billing Document | SAP Help Portal 
  • Solved: Mass download billing document pdf output - SAP Community
  • Solved: Printing and attaching the invoice form - SAP Community
  • Mass Download of Billing Documents Output for Commercial Projects (5BP) | SAP Business Accelerator Hub

entry.title: Set up Signavio Process Insights configuration
entry.content:
SAP Signavio Process Insights configuration

SAP Signavio Process Insights is a cloud-based tool, that helps companies understand how their business processes are working, using real data from their systems (like SAP CRM, ECC, EWM, SRM, S/4HANA, TM , Ariba etc.,).

It automatically analyses your processes; Example: How orders are created, approved, and delivered and shows where things are slowing down, getting stuck, or not following best practices.

Then, it gives you clear insights and recommendations on how to fix or improve those areas.

SAP Signavio process insights to SAP S/4 HANA system.

Source: SAP

SAP Signavio Process Insights connects to on-premise SAP system to the BTP cloud using the ST-PI plug-in. It must have the required ST-PI version installed and set up an encrypted HTTPS outbound connection to SAP BTP. Data transfer is triggered directly from your on-premise system.

There are two ways of connecting a source system to SAP Signavio Process Insights. You connect your SAP on-premise source system directly to SAP Signavio Process Insights or you use and intermediate system to connect your SAP on-premise source system to SAP Signavio Process Insights. Here we are discussing on source system directly to process insights.

Note: ST-PI plug-in versions must be updated regularly. SAP Signavio Process Insights only supports the latest available version, as well as the two preceding versions.

As a part of onboarding process, following activities need to perform

  1. Login to S/4 HANA, make sure ST-PI , ST-A/PI plugins up to date

Plug-In

Supported Plug-In Version

Notes Required for SAP On-Premise Systems

ST-PI

7.4 SP32

SAP Note 3659887 

7.4 SP31

SAP Note 3626118 

ST-A/PI

01W SP2

SAP Note 3611533 

 

 SAP Note 3600553 

 

SAP Note 3600554 

01W SP1

SAP Note 3537655 

 

SAP Note 3530899 

 

 SAP Note 3530940 

  1. The following users must exist in all S/4 HANA systems with respective roles

User

Role Template

User to set up system connection & schedule data collection

SAP_SDF_PINS_SETUP

Background user to perform the actual data collection

SAP_SDF_PINS_BACKGROUND_DC

Expert user to troubleshoot the system connection and data collection

SAP_SDF_PINS_SETUP_EXPERT

SAP_SDF_PINS_BACKGROUND_DC

SAP_SDF_PINS_SETUP

  1. Subscribe to the Application

Login to BTP with global admin access, and navigate to boosters. https://<cockpit_region>.cockpit.btp.cloud.sap and navigate to boosters. From your global account in the SAP BTP cockpit, choose Boosters.

 Search for SAP Signavio Process Insights.

The booster wizard loads, and the prerequisite checks run automatically.

When the check has completed successfully, choose Next.

In the Select Scenario step, specify whether you want to create a new subaccount or select an existing one.

If you select an existing subaccount, Cloud Foundry must already be enabled for this subaccount.

In the Configure Subaccount step, provide the details for your subaccount.

Select the plan you want to subscribe to based on your entitlements. Only those plans that you're entitled to are available.

 

Name

Plan

Type

Description

 

 

SAP Signavio Process Insights (technical name: process-insights-api)

test

Subscription

This application plan is available if you have the SAP Signavio Process Insights, base package. Select this plan when you want to subscribe to the application in your subaccount intended for quality and validation purposes.

 

 

SAP On-Premise Systems Only

 

 

standard

Subscription

 

 

standard-new

Subscription

 

 

rise

Subscription

This application plan is available if you have access to the solution as part of your RISE with SAP package. Select this plan as a RISE with SAP customer.

 

 

SAP On-Premise Systems Only

 

 

partner

Subscription

This application plan is available if you have access to the solution as an SAP partner with a cloud test and demonstration license for SAP Signavio Process Insights. Each license entitles you to one tenant and one application subscription.

 

 

partner-new

Subscription

This application plan is available if you have access to the SAP Signavio Process Insights solution as an SAP partner with a cloud test and demonstration license from the SAP Signavio Process Insights and Intelligence package. Each license entitles you to one tenant and one application subscription.

 

 

test-new

Subscription

This application plan is available for the sandbox environment for SAP Signavio Process Insights and Intelligence package. Select this plan when you want to subscribe to the application in your subaccount intended for quality and validation purposes.

 

 

standard

Instance

This service plan is available in addition to the application plan for your subscription. The service instance that uses this service plan is created automatically when you run the booster.

 

 
  

Each region consists of multiple data centres in different locations.

In the Add Users step, configure the authentication service for users, typically identified by email address, who will be working with the SAP Signavio Process Insights application.

Select two identity providers, one for the authentication of platform users and one for the authentication of application users.

The booster now runs and the processing progress of the various tasks is shown.

Once the booster has completed, open the SAP Signavio Process Insights application as follows:

Choose Navigate to Subaccount.

Choose Services  Instances and Subscriptions.

Under Subscriptions, go to the table that contains the applications to which your subaccount is currently subscribed.

Choose the link to the SAP Signavio Process Insights application. This is the URL of the application.

You've now prepared your subaccount for SAP Signavio Process Insights and are ready to connect a source system to your cloud tenant.

To be able to connect an SAP on-premise system, you need the details of the service key that was created with the service instance

In the SAP BTP cockpit, navigate to your subaccount and choose Instances and Subscriptions.

Under Instances, select the service instance for SAP Signavio Process Insights.

Under Service Keys, choose the link for the key that was created for the service instance.

Copy or download the JSON so you have the details on hand.

  1. Login to S/4 HANA system

Import the digi certificates

DigiCertGlobalRootG2 & DigiCertRSA4096RootG5

Download the certificates from below link

https://support.sap.com/en/alm/sap-cloud-alm/operations/expert-portal/setup-managed-services/setup-abap/setup-strust.html?locale=en-US&anchorId=section_1414159140

  1. Set up integration with SAP Signavio Process Insights

T-code:  /n/SDF/PINS_SETUP

Note: If you're using an ST-PI version that's no longer supported by SAP Signavio Process Insights, you use transaction /n/SDF/ALM_SETUP (Set up integration with SAP Cloud ALM) instead. The integration name can contain a maximum of 14 characters.

Choose Create/Update Destination and copy and paste the service key details to specify the details for the HTTPS destination of your SAP Signavio Process Insights cloud tenant destination.

Your administrator in SAP BTP can get the service key details as outlined under Getting Your Service Key Details (SAP On-Premise Systems).

You can also specify the details of your HTTPS destination manually as outlined in the following table:

  1. In the SAP BTP cockpit, navigate to your subaccount and choose Instances and Subscriptions.

Under Instances, select the service instance for SAP Signavio Process Insights.

Under Service Keys, choose the link for the key that was created for the service instance.

Copy or download the JSON so you have the details on hand

 

Property

Description

Token Endpoint

Enter the url value from the service key.

Note

When you enter the token endpoint URL, it must have the following format:

https://<identifier>.authentication.<region ID>.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token

This ensures that the HTTPS destination has the required prefix path.

Client ID

Enter the clientid value from the service key.

Secret

Enter the clientsecret value from the service key.

Proxy Host

If your organization uses a proxy, enter the host name and port number specific to your proxy.

If your proxy uses authentication, enter the user name and password specific to your proxy.

You can get this information from your organization's IT department or specialist.

Proxy Port

Proxy User

Proxy Password

Root URL

Enter your registration target.

Enter the application base URL (uri property) for the SAP Signavio Process Insights service. As before, your administrator can provide these details from the service key created in SAP BTP.

Note

When you enter the uri into the Root URL field, it must have the following pattern:

https://bpi-pia-core-api.cfapps.<region ID>.hana.ondemand.com

  1. Connect the system to the SAP Signavio Process Insights tenant.

Enter your background user and start data collection. Enter the background user that has the required PFCG role SAP_SDF_PINS_BACKGROUND_DC assigned in your source system and is authorized to perform the data collection.

To start the data collection, schedule the jobs for collecting data and getting the data collection settings from SAP Signavio Process Insights

Option

When to Use

Get Settings Once

·       For testing data collection:

Before you can test data collection for one performance indicator, the data collection settings need to be fetched from SAP Signavio Process Insights once.

·       After updating the data collection settings in SAP Signavio Process Insights:

If you've updated the data collection settings in SAP Signavio Process Insights and don't want to wait for the autodiscovery job to run again, you can use this option instead.

·       For connecting quality systems:

To verify data collection in your quality system, a single data collection is usually sufficient. Similarly, you also need to fetch the data collection settings only once.

·       If you're using the RISE with SAP package:

As a RISE with SAP customer, you're entitled to one data collection run only. For this run, you only need to fetch the data collection settings once.

Get Settings Hourly

Once you've tested data collection, you can schedule the data collection settings to be fetched every hour.

Test Data Collection

To test data collection for a single performance indicator and verify it works:

To test data collection, you first need to get the data collection settings once from SAP Signavio Process Insights. Next, you select a performance indicator ID and choose Test Data Collection. If the collection test was successful, a green checkmark is displayed.

Tip

If you're unsure for which performance indicator there's collectable data in your system, you can try using the Aggregated transaction and report usage (PETST03N01) performance indicator to test data collection.

Setup Maximum Processing Time

To set the duration for sending collected data for performance indicators before a timeout occurs:

By default, the sending of collected data can take up to one hour for each performance indicator. If your system contains large volumes of data or if your connection is slow, one hour can be insufficient to send all data, resulting in a timeout.

If you encounter data collection issues due to timeouts, SAP Support might ask you to increase the maximum processing time.

Schedule Data Collection

Once you've tested data collection for one performance indicator successfully, you can schedule it to run hourly for all performance indicators.

Restart Data Collection

To restart data collection if there are issues:

If your initial data collection didn't work as expected and the results in SAP Signavio Process Insights are incomplete or faulty, you can adjust your settings and then restart data collection for all performance indicators.

Delete Jobs

If you're using the RISE with SAP package:

After your one-time data collection was successful, you can use this option to delete the jobs for data collection and data collection settings. In this way, you can stop data collection from running unnecessarily while your system stays connected to your SAP Signavio Process Insights tenant and business users can continue to analyze the previously connected data.

Disconnect System

If you're using an intermediate system and have connected your quality system:

You can use this option if you want to disconnect your quality system from the intermediate system and connect it to your production system instead.

Proceed like this:

a.      Use this option to disconnect your quality system from SAP Signavio Process Insights and delete the jobs for data collection and its settings.

b.      Delete the data collected from your quality system in SAP Signavio Process Insights as outlined under Deleting Performance Indicator Data.

Now, you're ready to reuse the integration and HTTPS destination you've created.

c.      Exchange the RFC destination to your quality system with the RFC destination to your production system in step 2.

d.      Connect your production system in step 4 and start data collection in step 5.

Delete HTTPS Destination

If you want to stop using SAP Signavio Process Insights for the connected system:

You can use this option if you would like to delete the jobs for data collection and its settings, disconnect the system, and delete the HTTPS destination to your SAP Signavio Process Insights tenant.

Note

When you delete the HTTPS destination to your SAP Signavio Process Insights tenant, the data that was previously collected is still available in SAP Signavio Process Insights. For more information about how to delete this data, see Deleting Performance Indicator Data.

  1. You've now set up the direct connection between your SAP on-premise system and the cloud tenant for SAP Signavio Process Insights. You can use transaction SM59 in your SAP on-premise system to check that the connection is appearing under HTTP Connections to External Server.
  1. Background Jobs in SAP On-Premise Systems

CRBPA:AUTODISCOVERY

This job runs every hour by default. It requests the latest data collection settings from SAP Signavio Process Insights system. The data collection settings determine for which performance indicators data is to be collected and how often it is collected.

The job also requests the descriptions for the master data that's collected with the process performance data for performance indicators. However, these descriptions are requested once every 30 days only.

CRBPA:DC_CONTROLLER

This job runs every minute. It checks the available work processes, triggers data collection, and sends the data collected to SAP Signavio Process Insights.

The CRBPA:DC_CONTROLLER job only collects data for those performance indicators that are on the list the SAP on-premise system received from SAP Signavio Process Insights as a response to the latest request from the CRBPA:AUTODISCOVERY job. It also collects data based on the frequency defined for each performance indicator. To control resource consumption in your connected systems, this job only uses up to one background process and three dialog processes.

  1. Provide users with access to system data in SAP Signavio Process Insights either manually through BTP or via IAS using Okta SSO.

entry.title: Optimizing Accessibility for Cognitive Disabilities
entry.content:
Millions of people struggle with focus, memory, and processing complex information every day. In fact, the World Health Organization reports that one in three people worldwide lives with a neurological condition that can affect cognitive function [1]. While these challenges can be permanent for some, designing for people with cognitive disabilities benefits everyone. It helps anyone dealing with temporary or situational challenges that impact their ability to focus, such as trying to complete a task when fatigued or under high emotional stress, or simply trying to learn something new in a noisy, crowded environment.

A smiling woman with long hair and glasses, wearing a headset, sits in front of a computer. Text reads: "1 in 3 people worldwide live with a neurological condition that can affect cognitive functioning. SAP designs for neurodivergent people. Check out our tips for wayfinding and orientation, motion content and more!

Design for Accessibility is Design for Everyone

When we design with accessibility in mind, we’re not just checking a box, we’re creating digital experiences that are easier to use for everyone. Making interfaces clear, predictable, and easy to navigate doesn’t just help some users; it makes products better across the board.

5 Tips to Optimize Accessibility for Those with Cognitive Disabilities

Supporting users with cognitive disabilities means creating clear, predictable interfaces that support diverse ways of thinking and processing information. The guidance in SAP’s Accessibility Design Tools, Second Edition, and the Inclusive Research Handbook helps turn this awareness into practical steps. With these resources in mind, here are five tips to help you get started:

1. Prioritize Clarity

  • Prioritize clarity with plain language, simple sentences, and familiar terms.
  • Reinforce meaning visually and verbally by using clear labels and pairing icons with text.
  • Why? Unclear instructions or unfamiliar icons can cause confusion, which can lead to errors or task abandonment.

2. Help users understand their location

  • Help users understand their location by keeping important details, like task summaries or form labels, consistently visible.
  • Use fixed headers or status indicators so users don’t lose track of their place in a process.
  • Why? Users might forget the context, instructions, or earlier steps in a task, which can lead to errors or incomplete tasks.

3. Design clean, simple interfaces

  • Design clean, simple interfaces with a clear visual hierarchy.
  • Group related content together and reduce visual noise.
  • For potentially distracting elements like animations or background sounds, provide clear and easy-to-find controls so users can pause, stop, or hide them.
  • Why? Unexpected motion or sounds and visual clutter can be overwhelming for people with cognitive and sensory disabilities, making it hard to concentrate and possibly experience anxiety. Giving users direct control allows them to create a customized space that fits their needs, improving comfort and helping them stay on task.

4. Maintain a predictable experience

  • Maintain consistent navigation, layout, and terminology to ensure a predictable experience.
  • Use progressive disclosure and clearly announce changes in advance — for example, through banners or tooltips.
  • Why? Inconsistent patterns and sudden changes can be stressful and confusing. A predictable interface helps users build mental models and navigate with confidence, which can reduce anxiety and increase task focus.

5. Break tasks into simple steps

  • Break tasks into small, simple, manageable steps.
  • Use visual aids like progress bars, checklists, and grouped content to clarify the structure.
  • Include clear instructions, plain language, familiar icons, and specific feedback messages.
  • Why? A disorganized or complex interface can increase cognitive load, making it harder to stay focused, remember previous steps, and track progress. Clear structure and communication reduce overwhelm and help users complete tasks more confidently. 

How SAP Designs with Accessibility in Mind

Technology keeps changing, but our commitment to Accessibility remains constant. We're focused on ensuring innovation moves forward without leaving anyone behind. To achieve that goal, we are actively innovating how accessibility considerations can be integrated in all parts of the Product Development Lifecycle, especially in early phases like design.

Want to dig deeper? Explore SAP's Accessibility Design Tools, Second Edition

References:

1. World Health Organization. (2024, March 14). Over 1 in 3 people affected by neurological conditions, the leading cause of illness and disability worldwide.

entry.title: SAP Improvement 2H 2025 - impact for Proxy rights on supported tools
entry.content:
On 2H 2025 release, SAP referred in the following KBA https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3667810 that using proxy rights to access below tools will be non-supported:

Modules that Don't Support Proxy AccessModuleWas supported before 2H 2025?

SAP SuccessFactors Learning

No

Note: Before 2H 2025 there was a Learning proxy module option, but it wasn’t functioning. After 2H 2025, the Learning option is no longer available.

SAP SuccessFactors Platform

Yes

Note: The following features and tools have stopped supporting Proxy access:
  • Configuration Transport Center
  • Instance Refresh
  • Integration Center
  • Security Center
  • Proxy Management
  • Proxy Import
  • Security Permission Reports
  • Manage RBP Admin and Super Admin Access
  • Privacy Statement in user settings
  • Reset Password in user settings

The change of proxy access in supported and non-supported tools has an huge impact on customers current Proxy usage.

Customers have already requested in the following SAP Improvement 
https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/359099/?section=sectionDetails - "Return back the permission to access to the Integration Center under the proxy" to not proceed with this changes or rethink the deliver until 2H 2025 is delivered in production in November 2025.

If this is delivered in 2H 2025 then there are huge impact in customers such has:
- being able to use proxy to troubleshoot issues related to the listed tools;
-being able to proxy technical users to schedule and run IC jobs;
- Being able to proxy SUPERADMIN user in case of emergency and not able to access the tools listed;
- Not able to proxy Technical users and preform any RBP access management;
- Processes defined by customers impacted due to system behavior over proxy.

Customers are not able to opt-out this system behavior.

This deliver should be reconsidered, we suggest customers vote on the SAP Improvement mentioned in order to raise concern over this 2H 2025 automatically on change for the release.

entry.title: Re: The workflow event trace is active but doesn't trace anything (transactions SWELS/SWEL)
entry.content:
The screen of SWELS is badly designed, it shows that it's active but in fact it may be inactive according to the time range defined in the restriction, which by default makes the trace valid during one hour after the activation. After this delay, the field "Event trace switched on" remains active.

It's very disturbing.

This behavior is explained in the note 2498410 - SWEL doesn't capture event even though the event was raised - SAP for Me.

So, remember, don't trust the "active" flag, always check the restrictions.

Also, if you're working extensively with the trace, go to the restrictions and define a much bigger interval (till the end of the day for instance):

NB: if you really don't like this restriction feature and want to rely only on the "active" flag of the initial screen, you may ignore the restrictions by entering a huge time range:

entry.title: Re: Merit Calculation Based on Different Current Salary
entry.content:
Hi @MariaCarlotaAbreu 

Ideally you'd want to get them to use one and only pay component group so they can stay standard config-wise. Usually these requirements come from unique processes that they know are not right but they're still trying to put them into the system when in reality transitioning to new HR cloud solution should be when they readjust all this. I would flag this request as high-risk and bring it to the project managers for discussions with stakeholders at a higher level than the comp team.

Anyways to come back to your issue, not sure Compounding will work here. 

Here is something that would work:

  1. Create an MDF object with an Evaluate rule on it that says "If employee is in this country A, then set MDF decimal field "Current Salary" to use PCG value, if employee is in country B, set it to the PC value."
  2. Create an integration center job to feed this MDF with userID for all employees (there are demos in some of my previous blogs like here or here).
  3. Add a custom field on your Comp template with ID = meritTarget and map it to the MDF custom field "Current Salary".
        <comp-field-definition id="meritTarget" isCustomField="true" isVisible="true" hideInProfile="false" hideInForm="false" type="money" alignment="center" useFor="salary" readOnly="true" width="6" hidePercentage="false" hideAmount="false" percentageReadOnly="false" reloadable="false" auditable="false" displayOrder="14" reportable="true" needCalcTotal="false">
          <comp-field-label><![CDATA[Current Salary]]></comp-field-label>
        </comp-field-definition>

 

  1. Then go to your XML and change the code to be Target in this tag. 

If you have other recommendation columns they would need a similar setup, but unfortunately we can only do that on merit, lumpsum and lumpsum2. For lumpsum and lumpsum2 you would first need to add lumpsumTarget and lumpsum2Target fields from Design Worksheet then map them to the MDF field Current Salary directly in Design Worksheet.

If the customer wants to have another recommendation column than merit impact the final salary (for example extra), you have two options: use one of the lumpsumTarget or lumpsum2Target and have final salary fields designed as custom fields (vs standard ones). Or keep extra but make it Percentage only and calculate the amount based on the meritTarget column like this : ((extra/curSalary)/100)*meritTarget

All the best,

Xavier

entry.title: Re: S/4HANA Public cloud 的開窗可以隱藏不需要的公司代碼嗎?
entry.content:
Hello @Fang,

Thank you for the question. In S/4HANA Public Cloud, the proper way to prevent users from seeing or using the CN company code is to restrict access to it in their business settings roles.

Maintain Business Roles → Preserve Restrictions and Organisational Values

For each relevant role, configure the company Code as Restricted for Read, Write, and Value Help, and include only the company codes that users are authorised to access your TW codes. This restricts data access and, in current releases, also limits the options available in many value help picklists. SAP Help Portal-Maintain Business Roles

Recent changes assist with hiding in picklists

From release 2508, SAP introduced support for Company Code restrictions in Value Help dialogues, improving how Value Help enforces role restrictions. If you are on or after 2508, users’ F4 lists will more accurately reflect the restricted company codes you assign.  SAP Help Portal-Company Code Restriction for Value Help Dialogues

Optional User default settings for convenience only

Set each user’s Default Company Code to their TW code to ensure the correct value is automatically filled. This complements role restrictions but does not replace them. SAP Help Portal-Maintaining Your Default User Values

Notes: In earlier versions, the value help for Company Code was not always limited they could display all codes even if access was restricted at posting/view time. If you still observe that behaviour, it’s consistent with earlier guidance; the 2508 enhancement addresses it. SAP Support Portal-3356685 - S/4HANA Cloud : Restrictions on Company Code(M_RECH_BUK)

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How correct data on completed I-9 Form and E-Verify i...
entry.content:
Hi @JulieMcSwain ,

The person responsible for reviewing the TNC should select the option that New Hire information provided in the FAN is Incorrect. In our case, the employee entered the wrong SSN, so the option mentions correcting the new hire's form I-9 Section 1, but the exact text displayed for this option may be different depending on the error.

That will close the existing E-Verify case. The next step needs to be done by a user with permission to create a Trigger I-9 Flow in Manage Data (in our case, this is our IT admins). 

Go to Manage Data - Create New - Trigger I-9 Flow.

  • User: Search for the employee by name or username and select the name in the drop down once it appears
  • Trigger Type: I-9 Reverification, Correct Form I-9 Section 1 Data, or Correct Form I-9 Section 2 Data
  • Process: the 32-character alphanumeric string that appears at the end of the URL when you open that employee's record within the Onboarding dashboard
  • Save

This will create a task in the dashboard for the employee or the employer representative (depending on the Trigger Type you selected. In your case, Section 2 would go to the manager, HR, or responsible user depending on your configuration).

Hope this helps! 

Heather

entry.title: Separate “Tips” line under Restaurant category in SAP Fiori Expense Entry
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m currently working on the configuration of SAP Fiori for Travel & Expense reporting and I have a question regarding how to handle tips (gratuities) in the Restaurant expense category.

We would like users to be able to enter their restaurant expenses and the tips on two separate lines, but still under the same main category — for example:

Restaurant: 100 (Meal)
                       20 (Tips)

The goal is to have separate totals for meals and tips, while keeping both entries linked to the overall “Restaurant” category.

Does anyone know if:

  • there is a standard field or configuration option in Fiori that allows this (e.g., a separate “Tips” field under Restaurant), or

  • if it’s necessary to create a new subcategory or expense type (like “Restaurant – Tips”) to achieve this separation?

We’re on S/4HANA (Fiori environment), and ideally, I’d like to stay within standard functionality if possible — avoiding custom development unless really required.

Thanks a lot in advance for your insights and best practices!

Best regards,

entry.title: Re: SAC Numeric Point - How to show last year same day value
entry.content:
@Fiona_ 

Lookup also has a previous Year variation as below. You could try the below.

LOOKUP([Sales], [d/Date] = Previous("Year", 1))

If you are facing an issue with Leap Year handling you could try something like this.

A Year is leap year if its  perfectly divisible by 4, 100 and 400 respectively. So create 2 versions of your lookup one with 365 and another for 366 days lookback.

NLP = LOOKUP([Sales], [d/Date] = Previous("Day", 365)) // For Non Leap

LP= LOOKUP([Sales], [d/Date] = Previous("Day", 366))  // For Leap

Then a final calculated measure based on checking the leap year check

IF(MOD(TONUMBER([d/Date].[p/YEAR]), 4)=0 AND MOD(TONUMBER([d/Date].[p/YEAR]), 100)=0 AND
MOD(TONUMBER([d/Date].[p/YEAR]), 400)=0
,[LP],[NLP])

 

Hope this helps or gives you some idea to ponder.

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Crystal Reports RAS VerifyDatabase can't find an unkn...
entry.content:
Hi Patrick,

I've been thinking about your request more and I don't see this happening, R&D adding the same Macro it uses in CRD into the SDK.

If you have or get a support contract you can submit an Enhancement Request here:

https://help.sap.com/docs/identity-provisioning/identity-provisioning/submitting-improvement-requests?locale=en-US

All I can suggest is you will need to build this feature yourself.

As you know the RPT file retains the "image" of the data structure within the file, getting to it you can use various API's including the code below I use to get the Tables Links.

What you should be able to do is log into the DB, compare the SQL statement to what CRD is using and then do the logic to compare.

Here's how to get the SQL, must set the log on info first, you can then compare the SQL or run it against MS SQL and see if it reports an error and then interpret that MS error.

NOTE: you do need to try/catch a lot of this, for example if the Report uses a Stored Procedure you must set the parameters first, same if the report uses a CR Command.

Below code gets the SQL from the report:

if (ConWorks || crDatabase.Tables.Count == 0)
{
    // test if no main report DB then go to subreport logon
    if (crDatabase.Tables.Count != 0)
    {
        //gp.FromString("2-0");
        GroupPath gp = new GroupPath();
        string tmp = String.Empty;
        try
        {
            rptClientDoc.RowsetController.GetSQLStatement(gp, out tmp);
            btnSQLStatement.Text = tmp;
            btnSQLStatement.AppendText("\n");
        }
        catch (Exception ex)
        {
            if (ex.Message == "Fetching SQL statements is not supported for this report.")
            {
                CrystalDecisions.ReportAppServer.Controllers.DatabaseController databaseController = rpt.ReportClientDocument.DatabaseController;
                ISCRTable oldTable = (ISCRTable)databaseController.Database.Tables[0];

                if (nvp2.Name.ToString() == crConnectioninfo.DatabaseName.ToString())
                {
                    if (((dynamic)oldTable).CommandText.ToString() != null)
                    {
                        btnSQLStatement.Text += "Main Report Command: " + ((dynamic)oldTable).CommandText.ToString();
                        btnSQLStatement.Text += "\n";
                    }
                }
                else
                {
                    btnSQLStatement.Text += "\nEither Wrong log on Server Name: Database: " + nvp2.Value.ToString() + " does not exist\n";
                    btnSQLStatement.Text += "\nTable Name is: " + oldTable.QualifiedName.ToString() + "\n";
                }
            }
            else
            {
                if (ex.Message == "Missing parameter values.")
                {
                    // set parameter values
                    //ReportDocumentSetParameters(rpt);
                }
                else
                    btnSQLStatement.Text = "ERROR: " + ex.Message;
                //return;
            }
        }
    }...

 Hope that helps...

entry.title: Re: Automatically plan production order after component a...
entry.content:
Good day @Jakobstrom 

Thank you for your question.

The following references provide more details.

Manage Production Orders

Situation Template

Make to Stock (Discrete Industries)

To summarise, in public cloud, you can only automatically adjust production order through rescheduling or re-planning based on material/component availability. Direct automatic date shifts after Available-to-Promise check are not supported as in on-premise custom exits but you can achieve similar behaviour through the following standard functions:

1. Component Availability Check and Rescheduling Proposal:

  • When you run the Availability Check from your production order, the system calculates component availability dates.
  • If it detects shortages, the Reschedule Proposal shows earliest possible start dates.
  • You can manually accept the proposal to update the order basic dates.

 2. Material Requirements Planning based on scheduling

  • Planned orders already consider lead times and component availability when MRP runs with correct parameters.
  • This ensures realistic basic dates are calculated upon order creation.
  • Due to the clean core restriction in public cloud, automatic rescheduling of production orders after ATP is not allowed through custom code.

 3. Situation Handling for Component Delays

  • You can enable the situation template “Component Delay in Production Order” so that if any component’s confirmed date is later thatn the order start date, you will get notified to adjust or reschedule the order.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Add functional currency in VAT report
entry.content:
Hello @Tina_Hellgren 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, VAT reporting apps show values solely in the company code currency. The traditional GUI feature Alternative Local Currency accessed via transaction S_ALR_87012357 – Advance Return on Sales/Purchase Tax is not accessible and cannot be enabled in the cloud environment.

If your company reports in EUR as its functional currency, you have two supported options.

Use Output Control → Read Foreign Currency
In the Create Advance Return for Sales/Purchase Tax app, select the Read Foreign Currency option in Output Control and add the foreign-currency columns to the Additional List layout. This displays amounts in the additional currency, like the legacy behaviour.

 

Build a custom analytical report
Create a Custom CDS View or Custom Analytical Query on I_JournalEntryItem, including:

    • AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency (Local Currency)
    • AmountInGroupCurrency (your EUR functional currency)
      Filter by VAT-relevant tax codes or G/L accounts to generate a management-level VAT reconciliation in both SEK and EUR.

Please note that statutory VAT filing remains based on the local currency; the EUR display is for internal reporting only.

SAP Help Portal – Define Currency Types and Assign to Ledgers

SAP Help Portal – Advance Return for Sales/Purchase Tax (Public Cloud)

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Factory Calendar Special Rules - CDS View or API
entry.content:
Hello @GAK1 

Thank you for your question.

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, no released CDS View or API directly exposes Factory Calendar → Special Rules date from-to, workday flag, text. These are reflected internally in the working-day pattern but not as a dataset.

You can instead use the following released views and approach:

CDS View I_FACTORYCALENDAR – provides factory calendar IDs, validity, and descriptions.

CDS View I_FACTORYCALWorkingDaysPerYr – returns encoded working-day patterns per year/month, which already consider any special rules.

Join this data with I_CalendarDate to derive a daily IsWorkingDay indicator if you need day-level results.

If external access is required, build a Custom CDS View on top of these released views and expose it as an OData API through a custom communication scenario.

In the public cloud, traditional tables like TFAIN/TFAIT and transactions used in on-premises systems are unavailable.
Check  SAP Help Portal – Factory Calendar in S/4HANA Cloud and the Released VDM Views documentation for I_FACTORYCALENDAR

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Bank Statement not completed
entry.content:
Hello @panagiotism 

Thank you for your question.

In your case and based on your description, I think what is happening is when you import a bank statement, the posting logic uses Posting Area 1 for the main bank entry and Posting Area 2 for clearing open item. Which is consistent with the public cloud.

If Vendor open item is already cleared as is in your case, the system still expects Area 2 to find and clear an open item. Therefore, the statement remains Not Completed because the clearing logic cannot find a match.

In public cloud, you cannot modify the posting rules or disable Posting Area 2 due to the clean core restrictions SAP introduced in that edition.

In public cloud edition, you cannot skip Posting Area 2 in the posting rule but you can make the bank statement complete by ensuring that:

  • The external transaction type used in the bank account master matches one that is configured without an open-item clearing requirement, or
  • The system recognises the item as external transaction completed through reconciliation processing. This will ensure that Posting Area 2 is automatically marked as complete.

To summarise:

Posting Rule F010 expects you to have an open item for Posting Area 2, but your item was already cleard.

The restrictions in public cloud hinder some modifications due to Clean Core approach.

Your solution options are:

  1. To create a Processing Rule to mark as completed when no open items exists.
  2. Or manually mark statement as completed in Manage Bank Statements.
  3. For future automation, ensure your external transaction mapping in Manage Bank Accounts are correct.

The following references provide more details.

Manage Bank Statements

Overview on Automatic Bank Statement Processing

Manage Processing Rules for Bank Statements

Cash and Liquidity Management

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Limitation in Service Quotation Handling in SAP S/4HA...
entry.content:
Hello @Lasse96 ,

You’ve run into current design limits of Service Quotation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition:

SAP’s FAQ states you can’t delete an accepted service quotation due to a follow-up service order. The app also doesn’t allow deletions of open quotations, so the standard way to undo is to reject them, optionally letting it expire. SAP Community-Service Quotation in S/4Hana Service - Frequently Asked Questions

Sold-To Party change: For Service Quotations in Public Cloud, the Sold-To is not changeable after creation. Attempts to modify partner changeability through SSCUIs result in the same partner-procedure error you indicated; SAP considers this expected behavior.

Copy as template: Use Reference works, but keep original partner determination, suitable only for the same Sold-To. For a different customer, SAP recommends rejecting the incorrect one and creating a new quotation for the correct Sold-To. (See: rejection handling and  learning content.) SAP Learning-Explaining the Service Quotation Process Steps

Useful SAP Documentation

  • Microlearning: Using Rejection Reasons in Service Quotations and Orders. SAP Learning
  • FAQ (Service Quotation): Deletion/acceptance behaviour and recommended handling. SAP Community
  • KBA 3324390: Sold-To is not editable when copying if partner procedure flags it non-changeable. SAP Support Portal
  • Partner determination (help/overview): Background on how partner changeability is controlled by procedure. SAP Help Portal

Let me know if it helps

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Manage Landed Costs / Additional Costs Functionality...
entry.content:
Hi @cblikeem 

Thank you for your question.

There is no Manage Landed Costs Fiori app in public cloud edition. That name appears in on-prem/private cloud discussions, it isn’t a standard public cloud app today.

However, if standard clean core is adhered to, you can capture freight, customs, insurance, etc. When set up correctly, you can capitalise them into inventory value through standard delivery costs in Purchasing and Invoicing:

  • Planned delivery costs on the PO à Posted to a delivery-cost clearing account at GR/IV and distributed to the material when the supplier/freight invoices are posted.
  • Unplanned delivery costs on the supplier invoice à can be distributed to PO items so that inventory value is adjusted (This is subject to valuation settings).
  • Multiple vendors are supported by using separate invoices that settle the delivery-cost clearing.

Have a look at the following references for more details.

Delivery Costs (Planned and Unplanned)

Create Supplier Invoice with Purchase Order

Direct Procurement, Reconcile GR/IR Accounts: Business Background

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Why Is the Test Execution on my Test Plan remain 0% a...
entry.content:
Hello @oquijano0327 

This behaviour usually happens when the automated process runs without a bound Test Data Container (TDC) variant or without valid test-user authentication. The Executed: “Without Test Data Conta...” message in your log confirms that the test launched without an active data variant, so no steps could execute

Please check the following points

Ensure a TDC variant is bound and used. Add the TDC to the test process or plan, and select the variant as the default. If a run begins “without TDC,” steps will not be parameterised, and you will see “Executed: Without Test Data Container.” SAP Help-Test Your Progress-Add Test Data Container to Test Plan

Validate test user, login to Manage Test User. Plans stuck at 0% commonly trace to wrong or stale credentials for the test user. Re-enter a known-good password (or switch to SSO) and re-run. SAP Support Portal-2820953 - Automatic test processes start, but no progress

If you use an external IdP. You should configure Conditional Authentication in Test Your Processes; otherwise, runs stay at 0%. SAP Help Portal-Configure Test Your Processes

Authorisations, ensure admin/tester has SAP_BR_ADMIN_TEST_AUTOMATION from Maintain Business Roles; without it, key TAT functions are blocked. SAP Support Portal-3111932 - Missing role SAP_BR_ADMIN_TEST_AUTOMATION in Maintain Business Role app

In 'Manage Your Test Processes', open 4HH automate and confirm each step has an Automated Script (some tenants/plans miss synced content, so nothing runs). Refresh content and re-add the process if needed. SAP Help Portal-About the Application

General stuck at 0%” troubleshooting, SAP KBAs list these exact symptoms and recommend re-checking credentials, roles, and rerunning after fixing settings. SAP Support Portal-3087418 - Test Plan execution is not progressing or stuck at 0%

With best regards

Chuma
